topic: Deep dive: _sqlite3 standard library module in Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: Deep dive: _sqlite3 standard library module in Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: _sqlite3 Standard Library Module in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: Exploring the enhancements and features of the SQLite3 module in Python 3.11 and beyond.
key_points: Enhanced cursor methods and attributes for better data handling

code_examples.code:
async def create_table(conn):
  await conn.executescript("CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS users (id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY, name TEXT)")

async with sqlite.connect('database.db', isolation_level=None) as conn:
  await create_table(conn)

version_notes: Many improvements in Python 3.12+ but the primary focus was on asyncio support
Also, note that not all SQLite3 extensions may be compatible with asyncio
caveats: Be mindful of potential compatibility issues when using third-party SQLite extensions with asynchronous code
Ensure to test thoroughly for optimal performance and error handling
